channel.title: CVE Feed for ipfs -- go-ipfs
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ipfs -- go-ipfs

item.title: CVE-2020-26283|2024-08-04T15:56:04.593Z -- ipfs -- go-ipfs
item.description: go-ipfs is an open-source golang implementation of IPFS which is a global, versioned, peer-to-peer filesystem. In go-ipfs before version 0.8.0, control characters are not escaped from console output. This can result in hiding input from the user which could result in the user taking an unknown, malicious action. This is fixed in version 0.8.0.

item.title: CVE-2020-26279|2024-08-04T15:56:04.169Z -- ipfs -- go-ipfs
item.description: go-ipfs is an open-source golang implementation of IPFS which is a global, versioned, peer-to-peer filesystem. In go-ipfs before version 0.8.0-rc1, it is possible for path traversal to occur with DAGs containing relative paths during retrieval. This can cause files to be overwritten, or written to incorrect output directories. The issue can only occur when a get is done on an affected DAG. This is fixed in version 0.8.0-rc1.
